text: Zim is an unincorporated place in McDavitt Township, St. Louis County, Minnesota, United States. Zim got its name from a nearby lumber camp of a man named Zimmerman.Warren Upham, Minnesota Geographic Names: Their Origin and Historic Significance, Volume 17 (St. Paul, MN: Minnesota Historical Society, 1920), p. 492 Nearby is the "Sax-Zim Bog", one of the world's best birdwatching places. It was named for the two nearby, mostly uninhabited, towns of Zim and Sax. Every February the habitat hosts a three-day festival for birdwatchers. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Minnesota
title: Zim, Minnesota
